climbs.name: Loaded Chamber
climbs.fa: Scott D, Ryan Chamberlain, Mike Knarzer

content.description: First half climbs like sport, second half nice crack with hands, fists, fingers. Good rock, fairly continuous with good pro.
content.protection: rack of triples on finger size, otherwise doubles through #5. Triple #3 also good. 2 bolts
content.location: At the bottom of the wall that follows left side of trail as you hike down toward creek. Just before the trail down into canyon gets to the creek there is a faint climbers trail heading left to the wall. Follow for 200 feet to obvious crack in corner where wall begins to turn in the direction of canyon.

content.description: Varied climbing styles and trixy pro make this fun and engaging.
content.protection: Doubles .2 through #4 BD with one #5 and nuts. Bring a few alpines. Two bolt anchor at top.
content.location: First obvious crack system on left side of entrance gulley, past quickie wall.  Cracks of varied sizes trending up and left with a short traverse.

content.description: Cliffs on left side of the trailhead as your hiking down toward to canyon bottom. Cliff gets more pronounced as you descend.
